title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
Hi there, 

Got mba with no liquid damage. Just stopped working. The macchine boots in SMS bypass and working fine but not booting normal way. 

Magsafe led is always greeen. CHecked all main rails and except of PP5V_S5 are presents. PP5V is pulsing constantly. 


Any idea?

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message: I changed U7501 thinking it may help but same result. While U7501 wasn't on board magsafe turns orange as must.

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
"While U7501 wasn't on board"
Did you power on the board without U7501???
Check for short on L7520/60 now.

"The macchine boots in SMS bypass"
Some sensor blocks the SMC.
First check AVREF_SMC.
Next check SMC_DCIN/BMON_ISENSE and SMC_DCIN/PBUS_VSENSE.

Post exact PPBUS_G3H voltage and check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of ISL6259.

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
"Did you power on the board without U7501???"
No, just plugged magsafe and light turned orange. 

"Check for short on L7520/60 now"

Checked and not shorted. 

AVREF_SMC 3,3V

SMC_DCIN_VSENSE pulsing 0-1,5V 
SMC_DCIN_ISENSE - 0.03-0.06 V pulsing 
BMON_ISENSE - pulsing to 0-1,2V
SMC_DCIN/PBUS_VSENSE. pulsing 0-0.03 every half second. 

PPBUS is 8.62 and constantly goes down 8,5, pulsing too. 

ISL6259 

17/18 3.3 
27/28 20 ( it was first i checked.)

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
"PPBUS is 8.62 and constantly goes down 8,5, pulsing too."
You didn't mention that before.
If board works with battery, then could be leakage on the input stage.

"No, just plugged magsafe and light turned orange."
3V3/5V MOSFETs got voltage, you've lucky nothing burnt.

"BMON_ISENSE - pulsing to 0-1,2V"
1.2V is high enough to block the SMC.
"17/18 3.3"
Did you check directly between U7100 pins?

Try fake charger, or lab power supply with 60/85W cable.

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message: Yeah never ever apply power to a board without the TPS or bad things will ensue...

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
with fake charger doesnt boot . 

"Did you check directly between U7100 pins?"

Yes. 


With battery connected PPBUS is pulsing 8.42-8.44 battery disconected 8.55-8.62. Doesnt boot with connected battery



"Yeah never ever apply power to a board without the TPS or bad things will ensue..."

Ok John, thanks for info


Any idea what can i do?

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
Check again BMON_ISENSE.
If still pulses high, change ISL6259.

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message: SMC_BMON_ISENSE now not pulsing its 0.065V and stable. SMC_DCIN_ISENSE still pulsing 0.03-0.06

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
Must be other SMC sensor involved, if it always starts in SMC bypass.
Can also be SMC, if never gets orange light.
Did you test with correct Magsafe 2 charger?
Post exact voltage for PPBUS/PPDCIN_G3H.

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message: WIthout battery connected PPBUS is 8.54 than 8.58 than 8.60. PPDCIN pulsing too 19,9 to 20,2V

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message: In SMCBYPASS start ppbus is 8,17V. Is that normal?

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
PPBUS_G3H looks correct, even for SMC bypass.
Try another SMC.

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message: Tried new one. Now i have no green light and 8,18 PPBUS. Do you know if 980 YFC LM4FS1BH 5BB... (original that comes with board) can be replaced by 980 YFC LM4FS1AH 5BB ? Also in PDF says LM4FSXAH5BB

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
"Tried new one"
Really new???
Why did you buy that?
SMC has firmware, need to pick it from donor board, same model.

title: 820-3437 PP5V_S5 pulsing from 0 to 5.
message:
ok. I changed many times on A1278 A1286 and never had problem. Firmware is on 980 YFC/E ?


Will try tomorrow with donor
